summary.name: Algae Biofuel Producers (2010)
summary.description: This map shows known algae-based biofuels producers circa 2010.

overview.name: SGI Synthetic Genomics Inc. (from Exxon Mobil)
overview.description: C02 to Fuels: harnessing photosynthetic algae in open system to produce fuels and chemicals. Plant Biomass to Fuels: synthetic biology tools to develop new microbial solutions to convert lignocellulosic biomass into advanced fuels and chemicals 3.Coal to Fuels: discovering, culturing and optimizing microbes that can degrade coal and produce more value added products

overview.name: Séché Environnement
overview.description: Les algues sont récupérées dans des cours d’eau, élevées dans des bassins d’eau et se nourrissent pendant cinq jours avec du CO2 issu de la fermentation des déchets ménagers. Le liquide ainsi obtenu est alors transformé en éco-carburant

overview.name: SEAMBIOTIC
overview.description: Seambiotic grows microalgal cultures in open ponds using flue gases like carbon dioxide and nitrogen from a nearby coal plant as feedstocks

overview.name: Sasol/Qatar Petroleum Oryx
overview.description: F-T

overview.name: SASOL IPK
overview.description: F-T High temperature Iron Catalyst, C3 – C4 olefins extracted from C1 – C40 HC liquid, oligamerization, hydrogenation, and fractionation

overview.name: Sasol GtL
overview.description: F-T Low temperature cobalt catalyst, Primarily C1 – C200 n-paraffins and olefinic hydrocarbons, Hydrocracking, hydrotreating or hydro-isomerization, and fractionation

overview.name: Sasol Chevron Oryx expansion
overview.description: F-T

overview.name: Sasol Chevron Nigeria
overview.description: F-T

overview.name: Sasol Chevron Integrated GTL
overview.description: F-T

overview.name: Rentech
overview.description: F-T with UOP

overview.name: PROCETHOL 2G & consortium
overview.description: Biochemical conversion, Ethanol production process of 2nd generation

overview.name: Phycal
overview.description: Phycal is trying to harvest oil from algae without killing the algae. Instead, Phycal bathes the algae in solvents which can suck out the oil. Some strains of algae can go through the process four times or more.

overview.name: PETROBRAS
overview.description: This process involves a catalytic hydroconversion of the mixture of diesel fractions and vegetable oil in an HDT reactor under controlled conditions of high temperature and hydrogen pressure. The triglycerides from the vegetable oil are transformed into linear hydrocarbon chains. Bio-kerosene produced using transesterification and a extra a proprietary process that results in a FAE with carbon chain size similar to the Jet Fuel

overview.name: PetroAlgae
overview.description: Algae microcrops thrive in a CO2 rich environment, using CO2 gas as a crop yield intensifier. After being fully grown, the algae is harvested and separated into three separate elements: a diesel distillate, biochar, and feedstock. The diesel distillate created by algae microcrops is a direct replacement for petroleum diesel.

overview.name: OriginOil
overview.description: The company’s Quantum Fracturing technology combines with electromagnetism and pH modification to break down cell walls, thereby releasing the oil within these cells. Algae oil rises to the top for skimming and refining, while the remaining biomass settles to the bottom for further processing as fuel and other valuable products. This Quantum Fracturing technology uses micro-waves and ultrasounds.

overview.name: NSE Biofuels Oy (VTT/Foster Wheeler/Stora Enso/Neste oil)
overview.description: F-T - Carbo-V process

overview.name: Nippon  Oil,  Hitachi Plant and Euglena
Neste Oil
overview.description: Patented vegetable oil refining process. Chemically, it entails direct catalytic hydrogenation of plant oil, which is triglyceride, into the corresponding alkane. The glycerol chain of the triglyceride is hydrogenated to the corresponding C3 alkane, propane — there is no glycerol sidestream. This process removes oxygen from the oil

overview.name: Nanchang Yuanhe health-product Devoloping Co., Ltd
LiveFuels inc.
overview.description: Algea production, but the harvest uses filter-feeding fish species, in place of  energy-intensive mechanical equipment. These species can easily be processed into renewable oils.

overview.name: Joule Biotechnologies
overview.description: Specially designed photobioreactors, Joule reports direct microbial conversion of CO2 into hydrocarbons via engineered organisms, powered by solar energy; no biomass, no extraction, no refinement. Modular SolarConverter™ system converts sunlight and waste CO2  directly into clean, fungible diesel fuel

overview.name: Jiangsu Cibainian Nutrition Food Co. , Ltd.
ITERG
overview.description: Trans-esterification

overview.name: Inventure Chemical
overview.description: Pond-system algae production

overview.name: Inbicon (DONG Energy)
overview.description: Biochemical conversion

overview.name: Gevo
overview.description: Gevo’s biobutanol is produced through a process that utilizes fermentation. Gevo replaces traditional yeast with its proprietary butanol-producing yeast. Gevo has also developed a proprietary separation process that is added during the retrofit.

overview.name: Far East Microalgae Ind Co., Ltd.
ExxonMobil Qatar
overview.description: F-T

overview.name: ExxonMobil & Synthetic Genomics
overview.description: closed-system bioreactor with sunlight

overview.name: Enhanced Biofuels & technologies
overview.description: large raceway ponds that use waste CO2 from coal fired power plants as a fertilizer for the algae

overview.name: Dynamic fuels
overview.description: 2 biofuel processes, both producing the same type of isoparaffinic diesel and jet fuel: (1) direct hydroconversion of fatty acid/glycerides, and (2) indirect liquefaction of cellulosic biomass via gasification and Fischer-Tropsch conversion

overview.name: Dongtai City Spirulina Bio-engineering Co., Ltd.
DIESTER INDUSTRIE - Novance
overview.description: Trans-esterification

overview.name: CWT Changing World Technologies
overview.description: Hydrothermal process - The Thermal Conversion Process mimics the earth’s natural geothermal process by using water, heat and pressure to transform organic and inorganic wastes into oils, gases, carbons, metals and ash

overview.name: ConocoPhillips Qatar
overview.description: F-T

overview.name: CHOREN (Daimler/Volkswagen)
overview.description: F-T  Carbo-V process

overview.name: Center of Excellence for Hazardous Materials Management – CEHMM
Butamax (joint venture BP/DuPont)
overview.description: Biomass-to-sugar/catalytic

overview.name: Bioliq
overview.description: F-T - First, the biomass (wood, straw, etc) is heated at 500 C in an anaerobic compartment. This is a pyrolization process that is able to produce a liquid component known as biosyncrude. Afterwards, the biosyncrude is vaporized at high temperatures (1400°C) to render a mix of carbon monoxide and hydrogen termed syngas. The syngas is then purified and converted to a variety of fuels including methanol, hydrogen and a synthetic liquid version of diesel (biodiesel).

overview.name: Bio Fuel Systems (BFS)
overview.description: Energy conversion of the CO2 using 3 items: solar energy, photosynthesis, electromagnetic field (which increases the algae growth rate) to obtain a biofuel comparable to fossil fuels. Development of a super-alga with a very high capacity of reproduction and energy production

overview.name: Beihai Biology Care Deli Co., Ltd.
Avantium
overview.description: Hydrolysis fermentation

overview.name: Aquatic Energy
overview.description: Open-pond system: Use of clay soils allows the venture to proceed without using fixed structures or plastic liners on its ponds

overview.name: Aquaflow Bionomic
overview.description: Basic process: harvest and convert wild algae which occurs naturally in effluent management systems to biofuel.  As a result of this process Aquaflow remediates and cleans waste water systems.

overview.name: Amyris
overview.description: Terpenoids: fermentation with enzymes

overview.name: Algenol with Dow Chemical
overview.description: Algenol links photosynthesis with the natural enzymes that convert sugars directly into ethanol, using algae. The ethanol diffuses out of the cell and evaporates rapidly.

overview.name: Algae Link
overview.description: Early in 2008, AlgaeLink had announced a photobioreactor system for algae made of UV protected transparent sheets rather than pre-manufactured tubes. The sheets are assembled on delivery into tubes, saving 90 % on shipping costs with this configuration. Later in the spring, the company announced a new process for extracting algae oil without using chemicals, drying or an oil press

overview.name: Algae Link
overview.description: Early in 2008, AlgaeLink had announced a photobioreactor system for algae made of UV protected transparent sheets rather than pre-manufactured tubes. The sheets are assembled on delivery into tubes, saving 90 % on shipping costs with this configuration. Later in the spring, the company announced a new process for extracting algae oil without using chemicals, drying or an oil press

overview.name: Algae Biofuels
overview.description: Early in 2008, AlgaeLink had announced a photobioreactor system for algae made of UV protected transparent sheets rather than pre-manufactured tubes. The sheets are assembled on delivery into tubes, saving 90 percent on shipping costs with this configuration. Later in the spring, the company announced a new process for extracting algae oil without using chemicals, drying or an oil press

overview.name: A2BE Carbon Capture
overview.description: A2BE’s system will use plastic bags 40 feet wide, 400 feet long and 12 inches thick. Motorized rollers clean the bags and agitate the water to mix the algae to make sure it receives adequate sunlight.    A2BE Carbon Capture is developing bio-secure, scalable, climate adaptive, and highly cost effective technology for producing valuable fuel and food from CO2 using algal photosynthesis and bio-harvesting
